column5: * Says has reached definitive agreement to sell its British O2 unit to Hutchison Whampoa for 10.25 billion pounds ($15.24 billion)  after preliminary deal outlined in January

column4: Fitch Rates Teva's Euro Bond Offering 'BBB+'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  March 24 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB+' rating to the  unsecured Euro bond offering issued by Teva Pharmaceutical Finance Netherlands  II  B.V. (Israel) part of Teva Pharmaceuticals Industries Ltd. (Teva).  Proceeds are expected to be used for general corporate purposes. Fitch does not  expect a material change in total debt balances to result as a net effect of  this issuance  the February 2015 tender of USD-denom

column4: Land Securities sells Times Square  London property to Blackstone
column5: March 24 Britain's Land Securities Group Plc  said it had struck a deal to sell its 95 percent stake in an office building in Times Square  London  to real estate funds managed by Blackstone Group LP for 268.4 million pounds ($400.5 million).

column4: Aetos Capital preparing to sell Japan's Simplex  seeks $1.7 billion: sources
column5: TOKYO U.S.-based property investment fund Aetos Capital Real Estate is preparing to sell Simplex Investment Advisors  a Japanese real estate asset management firm  seeking as much as 200 billion yen ($1.7 billion)  people with knowledge of the deal said.

column4: U.S. consumer inflation firming; new home sales at seven-year high
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. consumer prices rebounded in February as gasoline prices rose for the first time since June  and there were also signs of an uptick in underlying inflation pressures  keeping the Federal Reserve on course to raise interest rates this year. |Â Video

column5: NEW YORK  March 24 U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Tuesday ahead of a data deluge including measures on inflation  home prices and sales  and factory activity.
